item.title: Drop down access and illegal parking, 17th February
item.description:
Constant parking over the drop down stopping the disabled and elderly being able to cross safely. Also dangerous for people coming in and out as one side of the road is blocked. The drop down needs a yellow box and the road needs red lines with cameras.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Square, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DVLA clamps now removed!, 17th February
item.description:
Now over 3 months. STILL no tax or MOT. Leaking fuel - dangerous and polluting. An obstruction for other vehicles and council dustcarts. Was clamped by DVLA until 4 days ago when clamps disappeared!! No change to legal status. Please re-report and remove this vehicle - soon.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tarnwood Park, Mottingham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface water flooding report- LOWER ROAD before Evelyn street junction, 16th February
item.description:
There is repeated surface water flooding along this stretch of road whenever there is moderate to heavy rainfall. While recent rain has contributed, it is clear the road drains/gullies in this area are not functioning effectively as water is not clearing and is pooling for extended periods. This presents a safety risk to both pedestrians and drivers due to standing water across the carriageway and pavement, increasing the likelihood of slips, trips, and vehicles losing control or splashing pedestrians. Prolonged standing water also creates potential public health concerns through stagnant water, debris build-up, and obstruction of safe pavement use. Please can the drainage and gullies on this section of road be inspected and cleared as a priority and the wider drainage capacity assessed, as this appears to be a recurring infrastructure issue rather than a one-off weather event.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shoes dumped at Planters on Tabard Street, 16th February
item.description:
There is a pair of blue trainers dumped at the planter on Tabard Street. It has been there for four days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Motorcycle joyriding late at night, 16th February
item.description:
There are frequent motorcyclists joyriding up and down the Thames footpath in front of the golf driving range. You can see the skid marks on the ground that show this late night activity (9 pm - 2am, sometimes later) The noise from that activity can be heard from the residents living across the river on the Isle of Dogs. It is meant to be a footpath for pedestrians and cyclists and not for motorcyclists. It is not safe for pedestrian and it is noise pollution.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge needs collecting, 16th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westcombe Hill, Blackheath

item.title: Playground needs repairing, 16th February
item.description:
This playground is in need of repairs. When it rains it gets very muddy and it takes days before it is usable again. Seating stools for parent are full of water, and the area where kids actually play are muddy. See pictures attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Entrance 30 on Grafton Way., 16th February
item.description:
This has bewn a problem for a very long time. The concrete around the manhole was broken and sunken,then a couole of weeks ago worknwn turned up. They dug it up,replaced the concrete wuth tarmac and put cover back. They put barriers at each side,but in less than a hour,a Tesco driver got out and moved them and drove through,and so does everyone else. The noise has gotren far worse than before,it bangs even louder whenever something drives over it. I feel sorry too for the 2 hoapitals either side,and the nuses in this block on nightshift.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grafton Way, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
